description: Demonstrate foundational lab safety, component identification, and procedural readiness in digital electronics settings.
Interpret digital timing behavior using binary conventions and waveform representations.
Apply experimental methods to identify and verify logic gate behavior.
Design and communicate multi-gate logic solutions using equivalent representations.
Use career and technical knowledge to solve authentic workplace problems.
Demonstrate integrated communication, problem-solving, and teamwork in technical settings.
Apply universal foundation skills such as responsibility, integrity, and dependability.
Identify and apply safety rules and proper handling of electronic components.
Interpret schematic and signal representations used in pre-engineering systems.
Analyze digital logic systems, test circuits, and document findings.
Use units and quantities to reason quantitatively and interpret data.
Design solutions to complex real-world problems by breaking them into manageable criteria and constraints.
Evaluate and refine design solutions based on prioritized criteria and trade-offs.
Follow complex multistep procedures while carrying out technical tasks and evaluating outcomes.
Integrate and evaluate multiple sources of information presented in diverse formats.
Synthesize information from multiple technical sources to support analysis and design decisions.
